ASA’s Partnership Dialogue Series: A Focus on Communication
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
Please accept this invitation to attend the second installment of our Partnership Dialogue Series. In this series - A Focus on Communication - we provide attendees the opportunity to discuss, ask questions, and receive feedback on some hot topics affecting lenders and financial aid officers around the country. As one of our lender partners, we hope you can join us at one of our events being held in two New York locations next month.
In this upcoming series, we will explore the challenges schools face of effectively communicating with students and families today. This series will encompass a broad discussion of the communication challenges schools face, the scope and message of their communication mission, what resources they need to succeed in that mission, and which outreach experiments to students and families have yielded the best results.
Our dialogue will begin after breakfast at 9:00 a.m., with schools joining us for the morning session and lunch. After lunch, we look forward to speaking to you about what ASA has to offer, why the guarantor you choose matters, and how ASA and {!Account.Name} can work together in the marketplace.
Agenda: 8:00 – 9:00 a.m. Continental Breakfast (schools and lenders) 9:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. Discussion and Exchange of Ideas (schools and lenders) 12:00 –1:00 p.m. Lunch (schools and lenders) 1:00 – 3:00 p.m. Understanding ASA (lenders only)
Choose the Location that Works Best for You:
Long Island - Wednesday, April 16, 2008 Long Island Marriott Hotel & Conference Center 101 Doolittle Boulevard Uniondale, New York 11553 http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/nycli-long-island-marriott-hotel-and-conference-center/
Syracuse - Thursday, April 17, 2008 Sherwood Inn 26 W.Genesee Street Skaneateles, New York 13152 (315) 685-3405 http://www.thesherwoodinn.com/
For registration and additional information, including driving directions, please visit www.amsa.com/fap/training, e-mail your name, phone number and enrollment details to training@amsa.com, or call the Training Department at 800.999.9080, ext. 3099. We hope you can join us, and look forward to seeing you there. Also, please also feel free to share this with others at {!Account.Name} who may not have received this e-mail.
Thank you, American Student Assistance
